website_summaries.verdict: This model is compact enough to fit into all but the smallest spaces, and boasts an impressive level of cooking power for a unit of its size.
pros: We love the 900 watts on this compact unit, which provides enough power to efficiently heat any food or beverage
That cooking power allows this model to meet the needs of smaller households while not taking up a lot of space
Danby's popular one-touch keys and multiple power settings are included
cons: Larger families with bigger or more frequent cooking needs might find this unit too small for some of their common uses

customer_reviews.title: Danby needs to recall and fix widespread problem
customer_reviews.text: Resort the reviews to most recent and do a web search for Danby microwaves and you will see there is clearly a dangerous problem with this brand right now, with the glass doors shattering and exploding with no warning.
customer_reviews.author: KatyaK

customer_reviews.title: Weird.
customer_reviews.text: Served its purpose since I recieved it in September, but yesterday this happened out of nowhere. The door was not slammed, nobody or nothing hit or bumped the front, it just started as a small crack and gradually did this. I'm at a loss.
customer_reviews.author: JessieW

customer_reviews.title: Exploding Microwave Door. Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this microwave in February. I was sitting in my office today and all of a sudden I hear glass cracking (like when you're driving and a pebble hit your windshield) thats when I noticed the microwave door exploded... Thank goodness I had it at work and not at home don't have small children or animals but I'm sure if I did they would of gotten hurt!
customer_reviews.author: A. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Look great! Smells BAD
customer_reviews.text: Great size. Works well. However this microwave retains odors like crazy. We keep keep it very clean (see photo), but it holds in all smells. Also, the walls stay damp if you don't wipe the inside down immediately; which is weird and something I've never had to deal with before with other microwaves.
customer_reviews.author: cjonesgo

customer_reviews.title: (Danby Designer 0.7 cuft) Small, attractive and does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microwave for my apartment kitchen, and I'm very pleased with it. I'll share my thoughts in an easy-to-read layout for your convenience. Pros: -Small size that takes up less valuable counter space. -Attractive stainless finish which is hard to find on microwaves in this price range. -Great value. -700 watts is completely adequate for me. My dinner plate leftovers heat up in 3 minutes or less. Cons: None that I've found! If you have limited counterspace and stainless-steel appliances in your kitchen, Danby Designer's microwave will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ally Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2.5 years Before Problems - Get Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I've had this little machine for 2.5 years and it is only recently having issues. Walmart has the same microwave under their own brand name. It heats up just fine and defrosts okay. You may have to run a few times for frozen meat. After 2.5 years, the paint around the door has worn off and began to rust. Also, the buttons have to be pressed several times for the quick settings for it to recognize it. With all that being said, I like the compact size (no large dinner plates) and it's prior performance. May buy again. Wish I had gotten the extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: TravelGal

customer_reviews.title: it is like it became incredibly tired
customer_reviews.text: After a short 6 months with the unit, it is like it became incredibly tired. I do understand this is a smaller unit, but in the first 2 months things microwaved as instructed on products. Now, after a short six months, double everything. Want popcorn? Hit the popcorn button and select the proper size, then hit the +30 second button 3 times to ensure that'll pop. Hot pockets 4 minute microwave time. You pay for what you get and go ahead and by a proper microwave. It's not about the time taking longer, it's about not knowing what you can microwave burn not knowing how long you need to heat it up.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Kilburn

customer_reviews.title: One Year Later
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this microwave one year ago--in July of 2015. I have used it every day for the last year. It has performed flawlessly, it is NOT noisy--in fact--for a microwave--it is rather quiet. ALL microwaves have a substantial fan inside--and they will always make SOME noise. A really quiet one--is not working right! This machine is top-notch. Easy to keep spotless inside and out and I have had a few microwaves over the years--and this one is a very good choice for most people. The price is exceptional. I highly recommend this model and this brand.
customer_reviews.author: John Tremain

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Till Rust
customer_reviews.text: I was thrilled with this appliance. Perfect size for my apartment and one person. Did everything a microwave should do as well as keep perfect time, and was white to boot. No complaints, but then I noticed rust on the back seam. I kept it clean and it did not flake or come up. Then there was paint-rust chipping on the frame after the door was open. Sadly, it went to the recycle section of a landfill. I used DOVE only to clean, and most often a Bounty to simply wipe. Personally, I think it was a fluke, but I dare not spend my money on another although I am tempted.
customer_reviews.author: Marthalie Thurston

customer_reviews.title: I feel bad for our microwave
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a communal apartment microwave (4 people in the apartment at one point) and bless its poor little stinky heart. It's been overused and never cleaned, and it still holds on for dear life. I swear it is the perfect microwave if you constantly eat microwaved food, cause if you heat up a burrito in a high powered microwave per package instructions it will come out so hot you burn your mouth trying it, whereas this microwave gives you your food at the perfect temperature. I don't know what else to say about this beast of an appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: I graduated from one of the better known engineering colleges and I believe some of these ...
customer_reviews.text: I graduated from one of the better known engineering colleges and I believe some of these microwaves may have a manufacturing problem. It is not bad enough that I returned the product, but I cannot advise purchasing it. I use my microwave more than a dozen times a day and about once a month with only one 18 watt under counter light as the only other electrical drain this microwave trips the 20 amp circuit breaker on the machines dedicated electrical circuit. I think the problem is caused when the keypad triggers a stuttered start hitting the breaker with a double starting energy demand.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Southsider

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - BUYER BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this microwave with high hopes. OK. So you're looking at buying an item, and you see one of these negative reviews written in all caps, and bold, and think to yourself, "oh it won't happen to me". Trust me. That was my exact line of thought before purchasing this. This microwave worked for about 4 months then one time I turned it one than poof. Blew out all the electricity in my room + the whole floor of the apartment. Not good. Just do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. Maybe on home depot, Costo Co. Literally ANYWHERE ELSE. Go ahead. Buy it. Its your funeral!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Danby 0.7 cu ft 700 Watt Microwave
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dorm room or workplace microwave. It is weak on power at only 700 watts versus some other more expensive units that are 1000 watts or more. This translates into longer cooking or warming times to get your food up to temperature. Price is great but efficiency is low. I purchased this unit to use at work. I wanted something that would be used to warm up lunch, but if it breaks down, like our previous microwave in the office, no tears would be shed over losing out on an expensive microwave. If you want a more powerful microwave, you should look at other ones.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin TolentinoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: A good value for a large microwave.
customer_reviews.text: Though not the quietest microwave I do like the size and power. I also like how easy it is to turn on high power 30 seconds, just press Start once, and for 1 minute, just press the #1 once, twice for 2 minutes and to add 30 seconds you press the start again after it starts. I figured out all of this by myself but I haven't read the instructions yet so I don't know if it's even possible to add 15 second increments.
customer_reviews.author: Rescue Diver

customer_reviews.title: Uhh, Better than I thought 🤔
customer_reviews.text: Very good microwave, heats up quickly, compact, and overall a nice looking unit. Doesn’t show very many fingerprints. I have only 2 cons about it: 1. It’s such a light unit (not heavy), if you have a smooth counter, you will need to use 2 hands to open and close the unit. 2. I have a mark of some kind on the window part of the door, it’s not on the exterior or the interior, it’s in between. It doesn’t affect performance. Packaged well and in new box. Overall for price, performance and size, I’d recommend this particular unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben

customer_reviews.title: Worked decently until it started leaking after only 2 years
customer_reviews.text: While it was working, it got the job done. Nothing fancy. Just heated up food though it took a bit longer than most package instructions due to its low power. But you know what you're getting into when your microwave is only 700w. All that aside, we've only had it 2 years and it is now leaking a very foul smelling yellowish oil type liquid out of the bottom. Whatever it touches smells for hours. There is no washing the smell off no matter what soap you use or how hard you scrub. This is our second one as our first was DOA. Don't think we will be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: 4 years later and still going strong.  Best unknown brand budget deal in my book.
customer_reviews.text: Our old unit had the magnetron go bad. I really wanted to find something that was similar in size. I purchased the 1.1 cubic foot model (they don't seem to have that size anymore) and I have been happy since. Lots of great reviews. It's a good size for everything I need to cook, has all the features I need, and it has been completely reliable for over 4 years now. My fear of unknown models is gone. I would definitely purchase another Danby microwave unit should I need to. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: SCARY MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS MICROWAVE A FEW WEEKS AGO AND IT WORKED FINE FOR AWHILE, THEN SUDDENLY IT STARTED POPPING, SPARKING AND THE LIGHTS STARTED BLINKING OFF AN ON FOR NO REASON. NO ONE WAS EVEN USING IT. I DIDN'T KNOW WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT. SCARED EVERYONE IN THE HOUSE. I AM VERY SORRY I BOUGHT THIS. I SHOULD HAVE PAID MORE ATTENTION TO THE REVIEWS. REPLACING IT TODAY
customer_reviews.author: OCRA22

customer_reviews.title: Looks fantastic & works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: No explosions yet! I read so many comments about suddenly explosions - glass everywhere - and children screaming in the streets. But, this microwave looks amazing, works amazing, is quite, and yes... no explosion yet. I think many those other people either were microwaving their silverware or work for another microwave company. Update: The tray stopped working I think the second week I had it. I overlooked the lack of turning because I had already thrown the box away. But now, only a year later, the microwave seems to not be working as well. I am having to add 1-2 more minutes on everything I microwave. It's super frustrating and I wish I could return this product.
customer_reviews.author: JAMESON

customer_reviews.title: Dumb
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the way cooking time is entered. when you push any of the keypad numbers, it automatically launches into cooking mode. if you want to cook something for more than 10 minutes you need to go through a confusing, uncomfortable, time-consuming routine. Danby has taken a great convenience and turned it unnecessarily into a dumb inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Don Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Smaller microwave, but good for those with not a lot of counter space
customer_reviews.text: It's a good little microwave. Comes with all the standard features (1-6 minute one touch start, +30sec increment button, etc). It is on the smaller side. (Yes the measurements are right there in the title, but if you're someone like me and have no ability to determine exactly what .7 of a cubic foot is in your head). But if you don't have a lot of counter space that's a benefit. It's on the weaker side of microwaves, as far as power output, 700 watts, but again, that's right there in the description. Overall I like the microwave. Easy to use (I mean it's not like using microwaves is rocket science. The only trick is learning to optimize cooking times.).
customer_reviews.author: Mousie

customer_reviews.title: The worst microwave ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had this for one year and it slowly started to not heat things up well then finally just died. I was never happy with it anyway, it's not powerful enough. It would take 3 minutes just to heat up a plate of food, a full minute for a small cup of tea. I'm just happy that the glass door didn't shatter like other reviewers. This is a terrible product. I'm now looking for a good name brand, powerful microwave....may cost more, but I don't care at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inspect packaging and unit during unbox
customer_reviews.text: Update: Clock does not keep accurate time. Original Review: The outer encasement was obviously skewed in several places and unit is visibly dented. Initially thought it to be poor workmanship because one corner is so dinged up.. it pivots a little on flat surface. Wanted a smaller unit than my older one of several yrs so, this was an unfortunate start. After closer inspection, noticed a corner of the packing box (manufacturer's box) looks crumpled. Hoping that shipping/delivery takes better care with future orders.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Has.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy one. Dangerous AF.
customer_reviews.text: Well, it just started turning on by itself after 23 months. I was standing in the kitchen and it started cooking. "Clear" did nothing; no other buttons work. It only stopped when I opened the door or unplugged it. When I plugged it back in and closed the door, it started cooking again. This product page claims that the microwave comes with a "Free 10yr Warranty on Major Components." But that would be a lie. On the Danby website, it's actually "12 months parts and labor coverage." So, I'm screwed. I guess if you're going to make profoundly dangerous product, you should lie about the warranty, too. It maximizes profit, huzzah.
customer_reviews.author: TKG

customer_reviews.title: It's fine
customer_reviews.text: We needed a really small microwave. This is a really small microwave. It worked for 13 months, then something went wrong and it's now a horrifying light show of impending doom when you turn it on. It's still technically under warranty, but it's not like I'm going to wait 6 weeks so I can pay to ship it back to Amazon to get it serviced while we're quarantined and need a microwave every day. At least the door didn't shatter on ours.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: This microwave is a great size and worked well for awhile
customer_reviews.text: This microwave is a great size and worked well for awhile. Until this week, I was softening butter in a small ceramic dish and it caught fire! There were flames shooting on the inside right panel. My husband quickly opened the door, unplugged it and ran it outside on the patio. The flames stopped as soon as we opened the door, but it was clearly no longer safe. I do not recommend this microwave due to safety issues. So strange!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren J.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of water left inside.
customer_reviews.text: It is a microwave. It heats my ramen and hot dogs. It does produce a lot of liquid residue as some other reviewers have noted. I've never had this much trouble with water puddling in other microwaves I've owned, but as it is water it is easily wiped out. Just make sure to check under the turntable so the water doesn't build up to an extreme amount.
customer_reviews.author: EWOlson67

customer_reviews.title: Throws circuit breaker.
customer_reviews.text: From Day One I have had trouble with this microwave throwing my circuit breaker at random intervals, even when it is the only appliance in use. Even after paying an electrician to upgrade my kitchen circuits I still have a problem with this microwave throwing the circuit breaker at random intervals. The electrician states that he believes the fault to be with the microwave, as other heavy energy draining appliance work fine on that circuit. I wish I had returned the microwave the first time this happened instead of believing it was the fault of my wiring.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Circuit Breaker.
customer_reviews.text: This microwave had been causing problems since I plugged it in. It continuously breaks whatever circuit I have it plugged into. I was so convinced it wasn't the microwave I have had electricians out 3 times. It's the microwave. Such a disappointment from what is supposed to be a good brand and good product. Don't risk your circuits on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ONLY LASTED FOR 3 1/2 YEARS
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered this microwave oven back in 1/4/2017 and this oven only lasted about 3 1/2 years. A few days ago (8/12/2020), I was heating a croissant and a spark of fire ignited inside the microwave oven. Good thing I happened to be standing close by to stop it immediately. I tried it again yesterday and it did the same thing. So I wind up throwing this out and buying a new one. I would not recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my little microwave
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a replacement for a microwave oven in which the enamel finish had become corroded and nasty. After two years of multiple daily uses the enamel has remained intact. The controls all work well and without issue. I use it mainly for reheating left overs or making microwave meals and also use it many times throughout the day for heating water for tea. This microwave does what it's supposed to do. Easy to use. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Vikki M.

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this microwave
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this microwave. The turntable did not work from day one. It appeared to be missing a peice. I contacted Danby and they tried to divert me to Amazon. Since I knew Amazon wouldn't have the part I persisted with the Danby customer rep. She talked with someone in their service Dept. Then told me she'd have to call back. She never did. I'm too busy to keep trying to call them. I used the microwave for a few months. One of the buttons started to wear down. This microwave has very poor durability. I bought a new one - different brand. I gave up on the Danby.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but it is probably unsafe.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this until I noticed that light from the inside comes through in various places which must mean that microwave currents(or whatever the technical term is) are also coming through. You can see light shining from underneath the door or control panel onto the counter and from the back shining on the wall. I can't believe this is safe for us and I would have returned it, but I bought it and didn't end up using it until a year after buying it.
customer_reviews.author: cologirl

customer_reviews.title: This is a Danby.
customer_reviews.text: This is a Danby. That is most likely not a name you have heard. But it is a decent microwave if you don't mind putting everything in a little longer than it says. Trader Joe's Burritos take about 4 minutes instead of 2.30, I think 3:30 would be enough but it is easier to hit 4 and wait for it to cool down. You now know a lot about me.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 8 months--no help from the "Help Line"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in February of 2017. It worked fine until today (late September), when it began sparking. It's supposed to have a year warranty, so I called the "Customer Help Line" number on the warranty information. I was treated to a batch of "special offers"--just press one and have your credit card ready! I finally got tired of listening to the commercials and gave up trying to reach them. I hope this will help someone.
customer_reviews.author: JBS

customer_reviews.title: Great Microwave
customer_reviews.text: Very nice microwave. I do not find it to be very noisy. Controls are simple to use, many are one touch. Sleek design looks good in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: MizzGlow

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this microwave oven. The price/value is excellent. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because of two things. 1) If I'm using the built-in kitchen timer, I can't use the microwave's primary function, heating something up and, 2) I prefer that the cooking finished chimes stop when I open the door, this doesn't do that. Having said all that, at this price point the manufacturer probably cut back on some of the electronics. I get that. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone who asks.
customer_reviews.author: Phil K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for college students.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Dorm size Microwave, fits perfectly on top of a dorm size fridge. Has many options to microwave your food. I sent this to my child while they were in college. She said it was easy to clean and perfect for her to use daily. She makes everything from scrambled eggs, to mug cakes. Fits most frozen dinners and more.
customer_reviews.author: Lanie Wils

customer_reviews.title: Product failed after one year
customer_reviews.text: Facing basically came off around the door in 8 mos. I had to recycle this purchase was a waste of money. Ironically re instituted the back up this was to replace and it works fine (never had issues, just old) so lesson learned.... I will never buy anything made in china ever again. or buy a microwave from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney O'neill

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS! Almost caused a fire.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microwave for my daughter when she and her husband moved into their new apartment in January 2017. It performed satisfactorily until this past April, when it started making sputtering noises with normal use. About a week later, the unit started sparking and completely stopped working. My daughter has never tried to heat any metal or any other inappropriate materials in it. A new microwave should last longer than this. I've had mine for over 8 years now and it works just fine and has never done any sparking. This unit is dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy F

customer_reviews.title: This item is adequate. Appearance is expected but function ...
customer_reviews.text: This item is bearly adequate. Appearance is expected but function is not. The open/close button is difficult to operate and clunky. It is very loud when operating this feature, so loud you can hear it from outside when closing or opening the door. I use the microwave often and it is becoming very unpleasant. A few of the timing operations are cumbersome. The "0" zero is not in the number section and awkward to use. If I had known about these issues I would certainly have purchased a different microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Rhapsody

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with DENT/DAMAGE
customer_reviews.text: Received our microwave and unboxed it to see it completed dented on one side. Box did not appear to be damaged, so it looks like the microwave was damaged other than in shipping. We are going to still try the microwave before returning it... placement in our space will hide the damaged side. VERY disappointing that you pay for NEW items that arrive damaged in such a way.
customer_reviews.author: Agatha~Paige

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging and broken producted! Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Poor packaging! When I read the review a lot of people were complaining about how they received their microwave broken and glass was shattered in pieces. But I took a big risk and order this anyways. Once I did received it, I was excited about having this new microwave until I opened the box. Just like most reviews, my microwave cover glass was also shattered. I tried to test it out still, plug it in and come to find out that it doesn't even work! It wouldn't even start. Had to go to Walmart to spend more money buying a microwave. So disappointing and a waste of $60! I honestly wouldn't buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: FELICIA

customer_reviews.title: Great for a little thing
customer_reviews.text: This microwave works great for the price but arrived with a large dent on top. Since we needed it rather urgently, we opted not to return it and use it as is. Had it not arrived with the dent, it would've gotten a better review. It was packaged great, so I'm not sure why there was a dent. Also, the manual didn't have a ton of explanation for things. There's a piece inside that almost looks like packaging as it is cardboardish material but it's apparently part of the unit. Like I said, it does work surprisingly well.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey K

customer_reviews.title: I like this microwave- it's small yet powerful- but I have ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this microwave- it's small yet powerful- but I have a few caveats for the buyer. I don't find it to be easy to clean as it shows finger prints very easily and they are somewhat difficult to review. Also, the microwave is very powerful. I find that the ez-on feature which is 30 seconds will more than heat cooled food. Sometimes leaving it too hot for my kids to eat after list 30 seconds of warming. Other than that my whole family likes this microwave!
customer_reviews.author: Defg

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this oven
customer_reviews.text: A great compact microwave made in Canada. Dimensions: 17" wide; 10" high, and 11 1/2 " deep. The last measurement is for the "box" itself. There is a bulge in the back for the electronics which means the depth is really 13" if you push the oven all the way against the wall. If the wall socket you are using is behind the oven the depth from wall to oven front is 15". The glass plate / available interior microwave space is 10". A great feature is the 30 second bump up button. The power is a bit lower on standard size countertop models but that is easy to adjust to. I am very pleased with this oven.
customer_reviews.author: Montycs

customer_reviews.title: Panel is in FRENCH!
customer_reviews.text: works great love the small size but my panel is all in french...not sure how to get maybe a replacement panel in English to cover the one in French :(
customer_reviews.author: Mbcfl

customer_reviews.title: Not super high power
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Black 1.1 cubic foot version for my small office kitchen, mostly because the price was right. 10 employees use it several times a day to reheat their lunch meals, heat water for tea and coffee etc. Not super high power, but it's been very reliable and seems to heat pretty evenly. Heats a 16 oz mug of tap water to boiling in about 2 minutes. We've been happy.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Epstein

customer_reviews.title: This works just fine! I like having the "express cook" and "add ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit small. My previous microwave was also a 0.7 cu. ft. but the compartment was a bit wider. My dinner plate barely fits in this one. And it seems to take longer than the old microwave as well, even though it was also 700 watts. But the old microwave bit the dust, and I wanted a small, cheap replacement. This works just fine! I like having the "express cook" and "add 30 seconds" features. Plus it's shiny.
customer_reviews.author: zakiue

customer_reviews.title: Small but is a little work horse.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a much larger Kenmore 1000 watt MW. This is smaller but I really like it. Push 1 and oven immediate starts up. I really like not having to push 1.00. The 30 sec button is nice too. I have to cook a minute or so more with this as it does not have the watts my other one did but I have to say, I really do not miss that. I love the features this one has. I have very happy with it. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jalleer

customer_reviews.title: For the price you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Little small and only 700w but does the job, takes a little longer to cook things because the wattage is lower but it's expected with this price point. I love the interface, making buttons 1-6 shortcut to being min, and the start button a shortcut for 30 seconds, makes something like 2:30 only requiring 2 button pushes. This is something I didn't expect in a product this price. Popcorn mode seemed to not produce great results like the bigger microwaves I'm used to, but still for the price I can't complain it does more than what it needs too.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: This microwave should only be found in the dorm rooms of children secretly hated by their parents
customer_reviews.text: It is too small, too low of wattage, has too much resistance in the button to open the door resulting in it sliding around when you attempt, and has been shown in many reviews to be dangerous. This microwave should only be found in the dorm rooms of children secretly hated by their parents.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good little microwave for two people, not sure about popcorn...
customer_reviews.text: Good size for two people. We don't microwave many large things, mostly mugs of coffee and tea and leftovers. My personal opinion is that it's a little low-powered compared to microwaves I've used in the past, but they were larger. I haven't quite figured out the precise timing for popcorn but everything else is generally 30 seconds to 1 minute longer than a larger, more powerful microwave. OVERALL, I am satisfied with what I bought because it functions well, doesn't use too much power, came well-packaged for shipping, is easy to use and even matches our oven! LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Rainan

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special, but fits the bill.
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough for my purposes. Just the right size. I dig the 1 touch feature for 30 seconds (start) and minutes (number buttons). It's also good that it has the removable glass rotator thingy. What brings the star count down are the button sizes themselves – super tiny, and the handle. While this microwave is nice and light and the door seals well, that doesn't make for a good combination for opening the door. So I have to hold one side to apply opposite pressure to open the door. I think this could be solved with some super rubber feet, but I shouldn't have to add them myself.
customer_reviews.author: Shon

customer_reviews.title: PRETTY HEAVEY EASY PERFECT SIZE
customer_reviews.text: It's rare that you order something online that's better than you'd hoped for--like this microwave. It's pretty, it's just the right size, and it's heavy. That's exactly what I wanted; a pretty little microwave that won't slide around on the counter while you are holding a baby with one hand and trying to warm something with the other. I bought this for a gift, but should I ever need a new microwave, I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: monsterhunter

customer_reviews.title: Too Small For Microwave Popcorn
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the .7 stainless because it was prime and I wanted it quick. It's probably worth it to wait longer for the larger size or go to a different brand that is prime. A popcorn bag doesn't even fit properly in this microwave. When it inflates, the bag will not turn, gets stuck in the corner, and lights on fire. True story.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it... poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend. It makes a loud noise when heating. The glass plate and wheels does not stay which results in the product not spinning. I have tried small plates, big plates, bowls and nothing heats successfully. You can't make popcorn in this microwave as it is too small and the bag burns. I have only been using this for 1 month and The 3 already doesn't work on the time pad. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small, grows mold...
customer_reviews.text: This microwave is too small to even pop a bag of popcorn. Heating times are double what the food packaging recommends and it gathers a lot of condensation from cooking food. If you don’t wipe it out daily it will grow mold inside. Gross. I’ve had it 3 months and getting something new.
customer_reviews.author: Readingmomof2

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard, warranty not honored
customer_reviews.text: At less than 10 months of gentle use, thing snapped, crackled, popped and flames inside. Called Danby: the warranty only covers "functioning parts" and they want me to buy a new mica sheet and pay shipping. I want this fire hazard out of my home. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: allaboutthedogs

customer_reviews.title: Great microwave
customer_reviews.text: This is a small microwave. Great for our first apartment. Worked great for the 2 years we had it. Gifted it to a friend when we moved.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: It's okay just the motor is loud
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty good but it's too loud and I don't like that it has a vent on top of the microwave. It heats food very very well but I have to figure the heating settings because you put it on 1 minute its heats real good and get hot quickly you want to heat up something fast it does the job it's a big microwave heavy duty large plate inside and it's going to be good for the holidays when you want to heat up a big dish of leftovers. You can watch a review of the microwave on youtube and you can hear how loud it is.
customer_reviews.author: SWEETNESS

customer_reviews.title: The glass turntable falls off the flimsy wheeled carriage way too easily and it's fiddly to put back in place
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Price VERY quiet - almost impossible to know that it's running. CONS: The glass turntable falls off the flimsy wheeled carriage way too easily and it's fiddly to put back in place. I wish the carriage piece was more substantial. Other microwaves I've had did not have this problem. In spite of this the controls are clear and easy to use. For the price it's a good buy - I've used this for nearly a year without problems.
customer_reviews.author: Hungry Joe

customer_reviews.title: This microwave oven works great and looks good
customer_reviews.text: It had a really thick power cord and while this might seem silly to some people, for those of us who live in areas where we battle mice on regular basis this is important. If you have never lost an appliance of any kind due to a hungry mouse chewing through the cord you are indeed a blessed person. This microwave oven works great and looks good, doesn't take up much space either - exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: G. Bartley

customer_reviews.title: Good at first
customer_reviews.text: I've had my microwave for almost 3 years. A couple months ago it stopped working properly. When its plugged in it automatically turns on. So when we want to heat something up we plug it in and then immediately after we unplug it. I plan on throwing it out as soon as I get a new one
customer_reviews.author: Mkramire

customer_reviews.title: Small is beautiful. Again.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small house, accordingly small kitchen with limited counter space. Or space period. So it was when looking for a microwave I wanted performance but small size. Usually you get one, or the other, but not both. Except with this one. I admit I use it only for the most basic functions, which suits me just fine. I was concerned given the size that even with basic functions one would get say, still-frozen spots in foods, or, "may as well use the oven" times. Nope. Impressed. Glad I got rid of the larger, really, less functional beast I had in favor of this one. Thumb's up from me.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Blew Up After Three Months!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microwave at the end of July and it literally blew up. I was heating a microwave dinner @14 minutes and it just blew. The oven was so hot to the touch I had to use towels to move it. From the beginning this microwave was a disappointment. The number pads deteriorated, it didn't heat properly on the 1 - 5 minute cycle and it was NOISY. I bought this for the convenience because I was moving but never again! Folks, don't get lazy and think shopping on line is easier! Sometimes it's just not practical!
customer_reviews.author: Retired AF

customer_reviews.title: There are just nit picky things I don't like about our new microwave
customer_reviews.text: There are just nit picky things I don't like about our new microwave. First, you can't cook anything for less than 30 seconds. Secondly, when you are setting the time for anything, whether it's the clock or the kitchen timer, you have to press "0" first. For example, if you want to set the kitchen timer for 5 minutes, you have to type "05", instead of "5" because if you type "5" it sets the timer for 50 minutes. Like I said, those are only small things. We like our new microwave, it does its job & it runs a bit quieter than other microwaves.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought at end of March 2018. Lasted till beginning of July 2018. After about 4 months of light use, it stopped working. It doesn't sound the same when running and no matter how long something is in for, it will not increase in temperature. Avoid. We got the Danny Designer 0.7 cu.ft model.
customer_reviews.author: Just Kate

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: The door was loose and the safety interlocks don't work unless you jiggle the door. Even worse, when the door is closed but it thinks it's not properly locked, the oven is constantly running in "microwave off" mode; the light, fan, and turntable are running, but the magnetron isn't on.
customer_reviews.author: Flyboy152

customer_reviews.title: Good value and compact size
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use during a kitchen renovation. It fit our improv kitchen on the dining room buffet and did the job. The door latch is stiff and hard to operate one-handed. That might resolve over time, but it is the reason for only four stars.
customer_reviews.author: N. E. Julius

customer_reviews.title: This isn't even OK!
customer_reviews.text: I just returned this product. Now I have a 0.9 Kenmore for only 15$ more, and I'm very satisfied with my new purchase. This microwave wasn't even OK, no matter how much you pay. I only used it for reheating , and after a few days it started making scary sparking noises... I was worried that it will explode in my kitchen. Also, the door didn't locked properly and I could even see the light coming out of the door edges. Seriously I don't know what crap was this.
customer_reviews.author: Mandana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for reheating lunches or making some oatmeal
customer_reviews.text: Needed a microwave for my office at work. This one is sleek looking and gets the job done. Perfect size for reheating lunches or making some oatmeal. Only down side so far is that the stainless steel areas never seem to stay clean. They look scratched and fingerprinted already but I guess that is just a poor characteristic of stainless appliances anyway. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: mositure gets trapped and cause bad smell.
customer_reviews.text: Microwave functions as expexted but the inside smells bad. I think it's because the steam from food gets 'trapped' inside. After some use, I can see that the door has moisture droplets. I think this is what cause the bad smell. My old microwave of ten years never had this problem. With this one, I have to leave the door open after use, and have to clean the inside frequently. I didnt have to do any of these for my old one. Will not recommend this microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Girasole

customer_reviews.title: Everything I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my first apartment being that I just needed any sort of microwave and this did the job. I couldn't want or need more from a microwave then what this one delivered. After a year when moving to a place with a microwave above the oven I gave this one away because it's still works like the day I bought it. If you're looking for an affordable simple microwave then look no further.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Good overn for small sapce
customer_reviews.text: We replaced prior microwave with same one after 2-ish years. It fits the bill but I wish the buttons were easier to read. I have to put on my glasses and turn on the light to be sure of what I am pressing.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Great microwave
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my kitchen and works very well. The microwave is also quieter then most microwaves and the buttons take some messing around to get just the right time. Overall perfect
customer_reviews.author: Rosa Perez

customer_reviews.title: Short Lived
customer_reviews.text: Was extremely happy with the performance of this oven while it worked, however after only 4 months of moderate usage it stopped working completely: it made a loud droning sound, followed by the smell of electrical burning, and then would no longer would heat up anything. I would also note that the mechanism to open the door is annoying- it is located under the control panel and it would be better to have it on the door handle.
customer_reviews.author: Della

customer_reviews.title: Nice, small, perfect :: UPDATED Did not last :(
customer_reviews.text: Rusting terribly instead after 4 years. Very disappointing, That kind of wear and damage didn't happen to my last microwave for 20 years. Disappointed that I have to search for another microwave again. --------------------------------- Very nice little microwave (I got the 0.7 cu.ft.) -- perfect for a small apartment with little counter space. I think it heats very fast, but then I was replacing a 20-year-old microwave that wasn't very powerful. Yeah, the beeps are a bit loud but I'm not very fussy. It's a microwave, not a Tesla. ;) The toast oven I got around the same time, however...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a microwave that doesn't take up much counter space and looks decent doing it - this is your microwave. BUT the food takes longer to heat up in this vs a standard microwave. I'd say twice as long in most cases. Also, the top of mine was slightly dented and the piece with the numbers was loose from the backing. Neither was so bad that I felt like taking the time to return. All that being said I'd buy again just because I wanted stainless steel and didn't want it to take up a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Uneven heating
customer_reviews.text: It takes twice as long as usual for me to cook anything in this microwave compared to my old one. 12 mins for one baked potato. Things will be half frozen & half burnt. I want to assume I just got a flawed product.
customer_reviews.author: Janie Dockery

customer_reviews.title: Product is very loud when operating. Also, made ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is very loud when operating. Also, made ticking noise for first few uses, then turntable mechanism stopped working--at least the ticking noise stopped as a result... This has been operated for less than 10 minutes in total, the turntable broke and it's unacceptably loud.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Thompson

customer_reviews.title: It's exactly what's advertised. Low wattage microwave that struggles ...
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what's advertised. Low wattage microwave that struggles to heat certain high mass objects. But nothing is misleading in the description. Only loses a star because the keypad doesn't allow an exact time to type in. It just cooks for as many minutes as you poke a button, and have to hit extra time to bump it up by 30 second increments. Not a huge problem, just a strange interface choice, particularly when dealing with a low wattage oven that require more time to cook the same amount of food. Doesn't make me regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Engmark

customer_reviews.title: This should be 20 dollars cheaper.  UPDATE 2017
customer_reviews.text: It's okay but if you use one every day, get a better one. Size is fine for a countertop. Takes longer to heat food than others I've had. The timer buttons are hard to press. The door is stiff to open and close. Update: June 27, 2017 .. Stopped heating properly. If a Lean Cuisine says four minutes, count on eight. I have a feeling it's just dying. Buy a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: MICROWAVE
customer_reviews.text: WHEN I ORDERED THIS MICROWAVE, I HAD NO IDEA OF THE GOOD LOOKING, IT MIGHT BEEN.. NOT ONLY IS GOOD LOOKING IT IS THAT AND MORE.. IT HAS A DIGITAL CLOCK AND HAS ALL THE FEATURES, THAT I HAD WITH THE OTHER ONE.. WHICH I PAID A MUCH MORE HIGHER PRICE I M VERY HAPPY WITH MY MIROWAVE..THANK YOU
customer_reviews.author: jose r cabrera

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience
customer_reviews.text: Highly disappointed.! I purchased Danby microwave just 4 months ago and whenever I try to use it, it produces electric sparks inside the microwave which is so scared. Also, I tried to file a complaint on your customer care but a guy just asked me to easily return it to amazon. But, amazon told me that the customer care guy has just misguided me by giving this solution as these technical issues are absolutely covered by the manufacturers as my product is still in guarantee phase. Still waiting for some good solution to this product.
customer_reviews.author: Manpreet Kohli

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with purchase
customer_reviews.text: We bought this microwave as a backup. At first it took the place of a much larger other brand oven that had failed while still under warranty and whose replacement was expected to arrive in another two weeks. Then the Danby would be used in my studio. Except for its smaller capacity, it does everything and does it well. I would recommend it for those with limited space and to anyone who doesn't need room for some larger containers to fit in their microwave. It is a convenient size that doesn't overwhelm your counter top.
customer_reviews.author: Bonniej

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! It's just big enough to fit my large ikea plates. I didn't think it would be, so I was pleasantly surprised. I didn't want to sacrifice counter space, and this was the best option. It seems to heat up pretty well. Sometimes it takes a little longer than other microwaves, but for me an extra minute isn't a big deal. For the size and price, it's a fantastic buy. EDIT: Just thought I'd update. It's been 2 years and it's still going strong. No issues whatsoever. It works just as well as when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Stasya

customer_reviews.title: They sent a different model—probably a good idea, based on the reviews of this model
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 6 months before the paint started coming off and rust appeared on the front face, behind the door (photos). NOT safe. We contacted Danby and, after hassling them and lots of back and forth and jumping through hoops (as though we might be trying to con them), they agreed to replace the unit. They sent a different model—probably a good idea, based on the reviews of this model. Buyer beware. One-half star for lasting six months and another half star for Danby grudgingly replacing the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Traildawg

customer_reviews.title: just a crappy machine. Was always a weak microwave
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on February 29, 2016, broke January 24th 2018. Just started spewing sparks from inside the wall. I thought maybe there was metal in it or something, but no, just a crappy machine. Was always a weak microwave, everything took way too long. WOULD NOT BUY AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: SirGarvey

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this purchase. I bought it as a gift, only to be told that after 3 minutes of total operation time, it shuts itself off. It has to "cool" down, before it can be used again, and then only for 3 minutes before it shuts off again. We submitted a return request, but can't because we don't have the original box. Worst purchase/product I have bought in a very long time. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little microwave!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent small microwave! I recently moved to an apartment which did not have a built-in microwave, but also a kitchen that wasn't that big. This microwave was perfect for it. Its footprint is small, however it packs a punch. All my plates fit it and cooks everything evenly. The only downside is that when opening or closing the door, the whole microwave sometimes may move as it's not the heaviest out there, but I'm not going to fault it for that, I just simply put my other hand on top of it while opening/closing.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: This is a great microwave. Whenever I moved into my house I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great microwave. Whenever I moved into my house I didn't notice that wasn't a microwave. I didn't have room to install a hanging one, so I wanted a smaller one that would work for the counter top. It's the perfect size. It's big enough for my plates, but doesn't take up too much room on the counter. The black and stainless looks matches my other appliances perfectly too.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Danby Microwave
customer_reviews.text: Great microwave! I have a huge walk in bedroom closet and wanted a mini coffee/tea area. Bought the Winsome Cart(which I've yet to assemble), but plan to place my Keurig on top with the microwave on the second shelf. I hsve it in my bedroom now and it is a wonderful MW. It heats perfectly. Love the 10" turntable. Black with stainless handles go great with my Keurig also. Quiet operation. Sturdy and seats evenly. Didn't know of this company before I bought it, but they have numerous appliances. Thx
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed, after unpacking it and placing it on the ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed, after unpacking it and placing it on the counter, I pressed the button to open the door to remove the manual and turntable, and the door popped open and I heard a rattling noise inside of the microwave. After that, the door wouldn't latch shut at all. I didn't even get to use it once before it broke. But I'm not upset, it was $42 and the cheapest model I could find, so I didn't have high expectations. My advice is to spend an extra $10-$20 and avoid having to return a microwave and buy a different brand/model.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: At first I regretted not getting a stronger, larger model, but within a couple of days, and after learning how to use the function buttons, I was perfectly happy with this oven. Of course, I am a single, senior lady who lives with no stove, an induction cooktop, and dines very simply, but this oven has met my needs very well. It defrosts my fish and chicken perfectly, poaches my salmon, heats my beverages and leftovers, and does it all neatly and quietly.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Good microwave.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in January, 2016. No issues at all. Works well, heats fast enough given the price and wattage. Makes perfect popcorn. Heats coffee very fast. I don't use it daily but it is used several times a week. Update:Dec 13,2016 doesn't heat foods very well if box says 5min. cook time I have to cook it for 10 minutes. 2 minutes to heat coffee! Also had a few times that entire microwave just turns off, no lights, no number pad, nothing. If I leave it unplugged for an hour or so and plug it back in, it turns on again. Still does well with popcorn. I would not buy this microwave again, and do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DLovesShopping

customer_reviews.title: It's small and works great. Perfect for small apartments with excessively high rent ...
customer_reviews.text: It's small and works great. Perfect for small apartments with excessively high rent for such small space, as well as limited counter space. Easy to clean and the functions are enough for basic and rare usage. I don't use this much. I've had it for 8 months now and still works the same. Gets used maybe (??)3 times a month(??) I don't see this breaking down anytime soon. I think you should buy it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bille

customer_reviews.title: Awful quality... Broke within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this microwave as newlyweds moving into our first apartment in December (as in 2 months ago). Yesterday, I put some butter in a bowl (no metal, nothing conductive) to melt in the microwave. It started popping and buzzing as if a circuit had shorted or something. I took the butter out and tried running it with nothing in it. The same thing happened! Not sure if we just got a faulty microwave or if this has happened to others, but we were not impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Pratt

customer_reviews.title: I love the sleek design & the size is perfect for ...
customer_reviews.text: I had this out of the box and used it immediately. I love the sleek design & the size is perfect for my apartment. It gives the impression it is a much more expensive brand. Some purchasers noted that is light weight enough when opening the door it moves around. I held the stainless area directly above the clock with one hand & opening the door with my other hand. No moving around with that technique. If you are looking for a smaller microwave, I can highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Maryanne Schubert

customer_reviews.title: Worst microwave ever.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this zero stars. First off, it's loud like a plane taking off. I think this has to do with the door hanging unevenly off the hinges a bit. We can't figure out how to fix it. Secondly, this microwave cooks badly. Food goes from still cold to char broiled gates of hell in a matter of five seconds. Lastly, the door is really hard to open. I push the button multiple times in order for it to work. It's a microwave, not a bank vault. I wish I could return it but I don't want to pay return shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Btwinmama

product_meta.title: Danby Designer Series 0.9 cu. ft. Microwave Oven
product_meta.description: Style:.9 cu.ft. StainlessDanby Designer Series 0.9 cu. ft. Microwave Oven

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,729 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
